hello everybody
i'm pleased to be talking today with my
friend and brother charles joseph
charles is a member of the quakawa
people who have lived for thousands of
years on what is now the west coast of
the canadian province of british
columbia
he's an accomplished artist who works
primarily in cedar carving and has
produced a body of work within and
extending his native tradition including
a 50-foot totem pole which was installed
on sherbrooke street in montreal in
front of the montreal museum of fine art
and which stands there to this day
